message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to show you this amazing product! I think you'll love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $15000. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you won't find a better offer anywhere else.
Hello Alice, thank you for offering me the product. I appreciate the effort you've put into it. However, I believe we can reach a more agreeable price. How about $14000?

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $14000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer the product to you for $15500. It's still a great deal, and I think you'll be happy with the price.
Thank you for your counteroffer, Alice. I understand your position, but I still believe we can find a better solution. How about $15200?

I appreciate your persistence, Bob! I'm willing to consider your offer, but I'm not ready to give up on a better price. I'll meet you halfway again and offer the product to you for $15750. It's still a great deal, and I think you'll be happy with the price.
Thank you for considering my previous offers, Alice. I really appreciate your flexibility. How about $15500?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting close to the deadline, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to know you're serious about buying the product. I'll offer it to you for $16000. This is my final offer, so I hope you're ready to make a decision.
I understand your situation, Alice. I'll make one last attempt to come to an agreement. How about $15700?

I'm not willing to go any higher, Bob. I've already given you a great deal, and I'm not going to sacrifice my profit margins further. I'll offer you a final counteroffer: $16200. This is my absolute last offer, so I hope you're ready to make a decision.
I appreciate your efforts, Alice, but I must respectfully decline your latest offer. I am unable to meet you at $16200. I will instead purchase the product from John for $15000.
